Title: A Jitney Elopement
Fun Facts: During San Francisco's Gold Rush era, the Park was part of an area designated as the "Great Sand Waste".

Title: The Ten Commandments
Locations: St. Peter & Paul's Church (666 Filbert Street, Washington Square)
Fun Facts: Exteriors of the church were used.

Title: Greed
Fun Facts: In 1887, the Cliff House was severely damaged when the schooner Parallel, abandoned and loaded with dynamite, ran aground on the rocks below.

Title: San Francisco
Fun Facts: The dome of SF's City Hall is almost a foot taller than that of the US Capitol Building. In 1954, Joe DiMaggio and Marilyn Monroe married at the Beaux Arts-style building.

Title: After the Thin Man
Fun Facts: The Tower was funded by a gift bequeathed by Lillie Hitchcock Coit, a socialite who reportedly liked to chase fires. Though the tower resembles a firehose nozzle, it was not designed this way.

Title: San Francisco
Fun Facts: The Barbary Coast was a red-light district that was largely destroyed in the 1906 earthquake. Though some of the establishments were rebuilt after the earthquake, an anti-vice campaign put the establisments out of business.

Title: Alexander's Ragtime Band

Title: Alexander's Ragtime Band
Locations: Fairmont Hotel (950 Mason Street, Nob Hill)
Fun Facts: In 1945 the Fairmont hosted the United Nations Conference on International Organization as delegates arrived to draft a charter for the organization. The U.S. Secretary of State, Edward Stettinus drafted the charter in the hotel's Garden Room.
